ships.name: Blight Shadow
ships.description: An invasive species from beyond our galaxy. They primarily survive by absorbing various forms of energy.

ships.name: Blight Hatchling
ships.description: A recently hatched Blight Shadow.

ships.name: Blight Mutation
ships.description: An invasive species from beyond our galaxy. They primarily survive by absorbing various forms of energy. These Blight Shadows have mutated into a stronger form that includes an organ to protect itself from incoming projectiles.

ships.name: Blight Horror
ships.description: An invasive species from beyond our galaxy. They primarily survive by absorbing various forms of energy. The Blight Horror has developed a special organ which allows the creature to generate bolts of red lightning that can interfere with mechanical devices. Unlike the energy absorption and draining organs that are used to gain sustenance, the primary purpose of this attack appears to be malicious vindictive destruction.

ships.name: Blight Terror
ships.description: An invasive species from beyond our galaxy. They primarily survive by absorbing various forms of energy. A Blight Shadow that has gorged itself on an unusual source of energy can become a Blight Terror, growing to an absurd size.

ships.name: Osk Lek Chaser
ships.description: A heavily modified Korath Chaser used as an escape vehicle by the Scrapyard Hermit.

ships.name: Palavret Tek
ships.description: Korath Scrappers who scavenge in the Scrapyard are using the technology they find to customize their ships.

ships.name: Rano'erek Tek
ships.description: Korath Scrappers who scavenge in the Scrapyard are using the technology they find to customize their ships. 	This Rano'erek Tek has enhanced shield strength and hull durability. Upgraded automation in its operations keeps the ships crew requirements low.

ships.name: Rano'erek Ik
ships.description: The dangers of scavenging in the Scrapyard has lead the captain of this Rano'erek Ik to make some modifications to its hull with a focus on strengthening the shields and expanding weapons capacity.

ships.name: Mechanized Mine
ships.description: An automated mine designed to create more mines. The Mereti developed this for deployment in distant systems controlled by hostile forces.

ships.name: Grakerat 572
ships.description: The Sestor deployed these expeditionary vessels centuries ago to extend their reach beyond Korath space. If one were to find a suitable planet to establish a base of operations on, the Sestor could rise again.

ships.name: Skoretak 13
ships.description: The Sestor stopped production of these interceptors a century ago. Their primary function was to serve as escorts for freighters.

ships.name: Tercheldar 150
ships.description: The Tercheldar 150 was a warship designed to fight in Mereti mine fields. It was eventually replaced by the more powerful Kar Ik Vot 349.

ships.name: Stakoshtar 187
ships.description: During their civil war, the Korath used this weapon against planetary targets. Scars from such battles still cover the surface of many of their worlds.

ships.name: Eave-Skiff
ships.description: The Eave-Skiff is a fighter carried by Kor Efret capital ships. 	Fighters do not come equipped with a hyperdrive. You cannot carry a fighter unless you have a ship in your fleet with a fighter bay.

ships.name: Vault-Barge
ships.description: A precursor to the Korath World-Ship. As more of their people resettle onto their former worlds, there will be a demand for smaller ships. In anticpation of this, the Kor Efret shipyards have begun reproducing these smaller freighters.

ships.name: Bravo-Monitor
ships.description: A precursor to the Korath World-Ship. As more of their people resettle onto their former worlds, there will be a demand for smaller ships. In anticpation of this, the Kor Efret shipyards have begun reproducing these smaller patrol ships.

ships.name: Delta-Ferry
ships.description: A precursor to the Korath World-Ship. As more of their people resettle onto their former worlds, there will be a demand for smaller ships. In anticpation of this, the Kor Efret shipyards have begun reproducing these smaller transports.

ships.name: Korath Ranger
ships.description: The Threshold-Destroyer was the first warship deployed at the start of the Korath civil war that eventually brought the downfall of their civilization. With the recent Blight Shadow attack on one of their World-ships, the Kor Efret are starting to reproduce these warships as escorts.

ships.name: Shelf-Sloop
ships.description: The Kor Efret have redesigned an old warship for more peaceful pursuits. The Shelf-Sloop is able to install larger engines than its predecessor while also accomodating a turret. Its weapons options, however, are more limited.

ships.name: Mereti Efret
ships.description: Translated to "Mereti Friend", this is the first functional Korath spacecraft made entirely from salvaged Mereti parts. While not fully autonomous, it is very nearly so.

ships.name: Korath Devourer
ships.description: Some Korath scrappers are more interested in harvesting raw materials rather than technology. The Devar'ur is their attempt to streamline the collection process. The Korath Incinerator is integrated into the ship and cannot be removed.

ships.name: Korath Explorer
ships.description: Korath Explorers were originally made to escape the harsh gravitional forces of Sagittarius A*. It is a science vessel designed for gathering data and resources.

variants.name: Grakerat 572 (Grakerat 572 (Infested))
variants.description: The Sestor deployed these expeditionary vessels centuries ago to extend their reach beyond Korath space. If one were to find a suitable planet to establish a base of operations on, the Sestor could rise again.

variants.name: Korath Devourer (Korath Devourer (Infested))
variants.description: Some Korath scrappers are more interested in harvesting raw materials rather than technology. The Devar'ur is their attempt to streamline the collection process. The Korath Incinerator is integrated into the ship and cannot be removed.

variants.name: Grakerat 572 (Grakerat 572 (Scar))
variants.description: The Sestor deployed these expeditionary vessels centuries ago to extend their reach beyond Korath space. If one were to find a suitable planet to establish a base of operations on, the Sestor could rise again.

variants.name: Palavret Tek (Korath Scrapper (shields))
variants.description: Korath Scrappers who scavenge in the Scrapyard are using the technology they find to customize their ships.

variants.name: Palavret Tek (Korath Scrapper (weapons))
variants.description: Korath Scrappers who scavenge in the Scrapyard are using the technology they find to customize their ships.

variants.name: Palavret Tek (Korath Scrapper (engines))
variants.description: Korath Scrappers who scavenge in the Scrapyard are using the technology they find to customize their ships.

variants.name: Palavret Tek (Korath Scrapper (carrier))
variants.description: Korath Scrappers who scavenge in the Scrapyard are using the technology they find to customize their ships.

variants.name: Mechanized Mine (Mechanized Mine (SD))
variants.description: An automated mine designed to create more mines. The Mereti developed this for deployment in distant systems controlled by hostile forces.

variants.name: Stakoshtar 187 (Stakoshtar 187(SD))
variants.description: During their civil war, the Korath used this weapon against planetary targets. Scars from such battles still cover the surface of many of their worlds.

outfits.name: Scrap Metal
outfits.description: Twisted wreckage from a destroyed spacecraft or other artificial object.

outfits.name: Anomalous Husk
outfits.description: Trace amounts of dessicated biological residue are attached to this mass of glassy material. It appears to be well suited for absorbing heat, but otherwise does not appear to possess be any unusual physical properties.

outfits.name: Blood Lightning?
outfits.description: The red lightning generated from this organ will slightly recharge the batteries of a ship struck by it. This is accompanied by a weapon jamming effect similar to, but different from, ionization.

outfits.name: Korath Fireswarm Access Temporary License
outfits.description: After this is acquired it can be found in the Licenses area when at the outfitter.

outfits.name: Korath Fireswarm Tech License
outfits.description: This technical manual details how to manufacture Korath Fireswarms. Having this makes it possible for any outfitter to offer Korath Fireswarms even if it is normally not stocked there.

outfits.name: Automine Deployer
outfits.description: A newly developed Mereti weapon, the Automine Deployer forgoes the need to carry ammunition. Instead, the mines are constructed using Korath nanomachine technology. These weapons were developed exclusively for use by the Mechanized Mine automata.

outfits.name: Burrower Mining Beam
outfits.description: This classic Korath mining laser lacks the shield disruption effect found in its modern counterpart, but is more effective for its intended purpose.

outfits.name: Korath Eliminator
outfits.description: The World Slicer is an orbital strike weapon that can carve deep into a planet's crust. Many worlds were destroyed in the Korath civil war by these tools of destruction.

outfits.name: Korath Fireswarm Nest
outfits.description: Each Fireswarm Nest includes a power charger to keep stored Fireswarms ready for launch. They also plug into your ships power systems, allowing surplus energy to be used elsewhere.

outfits.name: Korath Fireswarm Depot
outfits.description: The Fireswarm Depot stages extra ammunition in your cargo bay for weapons that use Fireswarm Missiles. The ammunition is ready to be withdrawn for use. Storing it this way uses more cargo space than if it were packed away in sealed crates. An extra crewmember is required to oversee maintenance of the ammunition.

outfits.name: Korath Fireswarm
outfits.description: Each Fireswarm Missile carries ten smaller missiles. When not being fired as weapons, they add to the energy storage capacity of your ship.

outfits.name: Korath Fireswarm Launcher
outfits.description: If multiple Fireswarm Launchers are installed, they will all fire simultaneously.

outfits.name: Korath Grappler
outfits.description: Grappler Gun projectiles are designed to pull a target closer to the Korath ship, to keep it from escaping.

outfits.name: Korath Incinerator
outfits.description: A giant smelter. Ships and asteroids go in. Melted metal comes out.

outfits.name: Korath Scattermine
outfits.description: The Scattermine Deployer is a crude device for deploying a cloud of stationary mines along the ship's wake. One drawback of deploying the mines in this manner is that premature detonation can damage the ship dropping the mines.

outfits.name: Korath Tractor
outfits.description: The Salvager Turret is used to tow derelict ships away from dangerous battlefields.

outfits.name: Korath Tormentor
outfits.description: An ancient Korath design, the Tormentor lacks the burst fire and synchronization features which were later implemented in the Repeater.

outfits.name: Tormentor Turret
outfits.description: Tormentor Turrets only have a single Tormentor mounted on their base, but have low space requirements for installation.

outfits.name: Obsolete Transceiver
outfits.description: This appears to be an older model transceiver incompatible with the encryption and authentication methods utilized by modern Kor Sestor.

outfits.name: Obsolete Transmitter
outfits.description: This device is designed to interface with older model transceivers and is incompatible with the encryption and authentication methods utilized by modern Kor Sestor.

outfits.name: Afterburner (Meteor Class)
outfits.description: Korath afterburners pump super-heated hyperspace fuel directly into a thruster's plasma stream, resulting in a phenomenal explosion that nearly melts the thruster.

outfits.name: Arkrof GP Hybrid Reverser
outfits.description: This Korath engine has been modified to be partially installed in a ship's weapon space, allowing it to push the ship in reverse.

outfits.name: Farves GP Hybrid Reverser
outfits.description: This Korath engine has been modified to be partially installed in a ship's weapon space, allowing it to push the ship in reverse.

outfits.name: Gaktem GP Hybrid Reverser
outfits.description: This Korath engine has been modified to be partially installed in a ship's weapon space, allowing it to push the ship in reverse.

outfits.name: Nelmeb GP Hybrid Reverser
outfits.description: This Korath engine has been modified to be partially installed in a ship's weapon space, allowing it to push the ship in reverse.

outfits.name: Blight Rifle
outfits.description: A prototype the Remnant created using Blight Shadow eggs. This weapon drains energy from whatever it is used on. This can disrupt electronic door locks and reduces living creatures into withered husks. This effect also replenishes its own energy, making it an exceptional weapon for long sieges. Death from this weapon appears to be cruel and painful. If the governments back home knew of its existence, it would probably be banned.

outfits.name: Korath Sentinel
outfits.description: A semi autonomous robot made with Sestor technology, these defense droids patrol high security areas on the ships of experienced Kor scrapper crews.

outfits.name: Slicer Torch
outfits.description: An improvised weapon made by a Scrapyard hermit. It easily and quickly cuts through ship bulkheads, making it an ideal tool for raiding ships. It can also be used to make emergency escape routes when one is seemingly trapped in a dead end. This weapon can get incredibly hot after prolonged use, so it may be unwise to use it for defending against extended sieges.

outfits.name: Blight Shadow Eggs
outfits.description: Alien eggs found in a derelict space station. Might be worth something to the right person.

outfits.name: Node 8 Jammer
outfits.description: This resembles a clump of Kor Mereti Reasoning Nodes, but is an obvious fake when compared to the real thing. Despite this, it's a sophisticated piece of technology with the ability to disrupt communications on a network it's installed on.

outfits.name: Node 8 Processor
outfits.description: This resembles a clump of Kor Mereti Reasoning Nodes. It must be related to the Mereti communications network somehow.

outfits.name: Efret Salvage License
outfits.description: Gives you access to salvaged outfits from the Kor Efret. You're not sure if this is a formal license or simply a means to communicate to the outfitter that you're looking for used parts...

outfits.name: Korath Afterburner
outfits.description: Korath afterburners pump super-heated hyperspace fuel directly into a thruster's plasma stream, resulting in a phenomenal explosion that nearly melts the thruster.

outfits.name: Korath Smelter
outfits.description: A giant smelter. Ships go in. Melted metal comes out.
